title: Olivia DeJonge to play Elvis' sweetheart Priscilla Presley in Baz Luhrmann biopic
text:
Rock'n roll legend Elvis Presley (C) is surrounded by fans after a concert, in 1958

Australian actress Olivia DeJonge has been tapped to play the role of Priscilla Presley in director Baz Luhrmann's upcoming Elvis Presley biopic.

The Warner Bros. project -- which is as yet untitled - is due out in theatres on October 1, 2021, and will center on the relationship between the young King of Rock & Roll (to be played by Austin Butler) and his veteran manager Col. Tom Parker (to be played by Tom Hanks).

DeJonge -- whose feature credits include M. Night Shyamalan's "The Visit" and "The Sisterhood of Night" -- has been cast as Miss. Presley, who broke out in 1956 with "Heartbreak Hotel" and became Elvis' future wife while he was serving in the U.S. Army in Germany. The couple married in 1967 and divorced in 1973.

Luhrmann co-wrote the script with Craig Pearce, and the project marks the iconic helmer's first film since his adaptation of "The Great Gatsby" starring Leonardo DiCaprio.

Shooting on the movie is expected to start at the beginning of 2020 in Australia to accommodate Hanks' schedule (via Variety) .
